abstract: The indisputable 1968 C-130 fatigue/crack growth data is reviewed to obtain additional useful information on fatigue and crack growth. The proven Load Environment Model concept derived empirically from F-105D multichannel recorder data is refined to a simpler method by going from 8 to 5 variables in the spectra without a decrease in accuracy. This approach provides the true fatigue/crack growth and load environment by structural component for both fatigue and strength design. Methods are presented for defining fatigue scatter and damage at crack initiation. These design tools and criteria may be used for both metal and composite aircraft structure.
title: Aircraft fatigue and crack growth considering loads by structural component

publications.publicationName: NASA. Langley Research Center, FAA(NASA International Symposium on Advanced Structural Integrity Methods for Airframe Durability and Damage Tolerance, Part 2
